LEVEL: I have a basic knowledge of the framework. Understand the framework principles and can implement solutions defined at the documentation or tutorials
I can separate concepts and I have a proper usage of actions and reducers
I am capable of write handlers for parametrized routes, also I can manipulate middleware, Request and Response objects
I know which is the primary use of npm and package.json
I have a very basic idea of the most common topics (crossplatform,  SIGINT..)
I can handle basic debuging issues in runtime
I understand the basics and can read and modify existing code.
I have a very basic idea of the most common topics (Libraries, Serial Port, comm, hardware components)
I know the basics about Testing (concepts, e2e, unit...)
I work effectively modifying existing solutions implemented with it.
I know the library and the test runner concept
I work effectively within established web client architectures, following current best practices

I have a basic knowledge of HTML.
I know how to make a style rule.
I understand the differences between a tag, ID, and class rule declaration.
I understand how styles ‘cascade’ downward.
I know some basic style rules, like color, font-family, background-color.
I know how to insert CSS files into HTML documents.

I have an understanding of how opening tags and closing tags work
I know how to create an HTML document with the proper DOCTYPE
I know how to nest HTML tags within another
I know how to use attributes, and use them to inline style or add required data. For example the <a> href attribute.
I know how to use <style> and <script> to put CSS and JavaScript onto a HTML document
I know how to install and run a MongoDB instance and how to run complex queries with aggregation pipeline and how to create a basic index
I knows the basic syntax. I can select and filter data across multiple tables and I understand inner/outer/cross joins
I'm able to create my own images. I'm able to deploy docker containers with a custom configuration. I'm able to monitoring the containers (on a basic level, e.g. know that they are running).
I have worked on some project using the basic functions of code versioning
I have basic dependency injection notions and I am able to work on an existing project.
I am able to import an existing project and modify its dependencies.
I have the necessary linguistic skills to work and have effectives conversations with native people even making some mistakes. My level is similar to the B2 certification.
I know the fundamentals of Bus Messages and I have used them in some projects.
I understand the basic concepts of virtualization.  I am able to create basic virtual machines and to install the operative system in them.
